com.java.model.player

Class HumanMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.java.model.Observable
      • com.java.model.player.PlayerStrategy
        • com.java.model.player.HumanMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class HumanMode
extends PlayerStrategy
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is a player strategy that is created startuphase.java and is a subclass of player strategy, all the methods are called from player(context class). This strategy behaves as a human, it receives inputs from the user.
    Version:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Arnav Bhardwaj, Karan Dhingra, Ghalia Elkerdi, Sahil Singh Sodhi, Cristian Rodriguez
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void executeReinforcement()
        The executeAttack() method encompasses the overall attack phase logic and flow including both single and all-out mode. Attack phase ends when player either no longer wants to attack, or cannot attack.

      • getDesiredDiceCountFromPlayer

        public java.lang.Integer getDesiredDiceCountFromPlayer(java.lang.String player,
                                                       java.lang.String country,
                                                       java.lang.String action)
        Helper method to get and also validate the attacker and defender's dice selections. This is meant to be a generic functionality which tailors to both actions.
        Specified by:
        getDesiredDiceCountFromPlayer in class PlayerStrategy
        Parameters:
        player: - the player rolling the dice.
        country: - either the source country to attack from / the target country to be attacked
        action: - either attack/defense.
        Returns:
        selectedDiceCount: a valid number of dice player can roll.
